intro: Lindernia chinensis, commonly known as Chinese lindernia, is a flowering plant native to China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and long blooming period. Lindernia chinensis is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
